title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox signed Alex Bregman to a three-year, $120 million contract in February.
Bregman's contract includes opt-out options, creating rumors about his potential free agency.
Red Sox President Sam Kennedy states Bregman wants to remain with the team beyond this season.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick said Tom Brady made the right decision to leave the Patriots due to team rebuilding needs.
After leaving the Patriots, Brady signed with the Buccaneers, winning a Super Bowl in his first season there.
Belichick faced criticism for poor drafting and roster decisions, contributing to the Patriots' decline post-Brady.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Former West Boylston town administrator James Ryan sues town for $1.3 million, alleging wrongful termination.
Ryan was fired after a dispute with Police Chief Dennis Minnich over a Trump flag on police department property.
Ryan's lawsuit claims firing was retaliation for enforcing ethics laws banning political signs in public buildings.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old was hospitalized with severe burns in North Smithfield, R.I. after a TikTok challenge.
The incident involved pouring gasoline, lighting themselves on fire, and jumping into Slatersville Reservoir.
The 16-year-old participant did not sustain injuries; no trespassing charges have been filed.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett officials canceled the Fiesta Del Rio event scheduled for Sept. 20 amid recent ICE raids in the area.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria cited fear and uncertainty in the community as reasons for not holding the Hispanic Heritage Month festival.
The event, celebrating Hispanic culture, was set at Rivergreen Park and featured live music, art, and local food vendors.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft suspended his Boston mayoral campaign after losing to Mayor Michelle Wu by nearly 50 points in the preliminary election.
Kraft, a philanthropist, spent $5.5 million of his own money on the campaign, significantly out-raising Wu.
Kraft plans to donate $3 million to address humanitarian issues despite exiting the mayoral race.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye's capabilities despite a challenging start to the season with the Patriots.
Maye faced criticism after throwing an interception and the offense struggling during a loss to the Raiders.
McDaniels emphasizes a long-term approach for Maye, focusing on gradual improvement and experience in the NFL.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two squirrels painted red and blue were found in East Hartford near Naubuc Avenue and High Street.
East Hartford Animal Control is collaborating with a wildlife rehabilitator to determine the best aid for the squirrels.
Anyone with information about the painted squirrels incident is urged to contact East Hartford Animal Control at 860-291-7572.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers are on leave for social media posts reacting to Charlie Kirk's death, causing police presence at their schools.
Wachusett Regional School District and Framingham Public Schools confirmed teachers' leaves, condemning the inappropriate online comments.
Charlie Kirk, 31, was shot and killed in Utah; he was a conservative activist and founder of Turning Point USA.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, acquired in a Bruins roster overhaul, is vying for an NHL spot this fall.
Minten, a 21-year-old center, played 25 NHL games between Boston and Toronto last season.
Minten will lead a Bruins team in the 2025 Prospects Challenge, showcasing his role model qualities.
